explanation: The bug is in the expression using min(d). That picks the smallest element of the list d, but the intended logic requires using the largest element (max(d)). I fixed that single token so the program adds the maximum value from d instead of the minimum.
fixed_code:
n, p, q = map(int, input().split(' '))
d = list(map(int, input().split(' ')))
print(min(p, p - q + max(d)))
